stories.text:
has anyone seen this. I sent a "hi A'to person A, this is evidenced in the person A chat log, i recieved a reply from B, all normal. However, I got a reply from person B (not a group chat). B was asking me why I was calling him, but i sent a screen shot of my chat proving that I had sent nothing. B then sends me a screen shot showing my message!!!!

1) this was not a group chat 2) I did not delete the message 3) the message recieved by both A and B has the same time stamp (therefore proving that they were not sent sequentially)

regards rtnrscal
stories.title: WhatsApp: dual sending of message to an inactive chat

stories.text: Hi HN, I have a friend who is a phenomenal project manager for a well established company. She's wanting to go remote but the current company she works for is inflexible or just behind the curve. Should she try to transition to product management? Or find a community that hires project managers (which one)?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best strategy for friend, Project Manager wanting remote?
